entry.dcterms:description: the Roma make up 4-5 percent of the population, the survey examined their ethnic-based residential segregation, changing of tendencies over time and the social effects of the segregation; the aim was the identification of the segregated Gypsy zones and their characterization with the help of aggregated data in the 1990 census data

An aggregated data file containing all of the segregated, normal, and small Roma-inhabited voting districts, and normal, probably mostly Roma-inhabited voting districts. From the e89b data file the e89e data file can be separated using the 2, 3, 13 values of the SZEGKISK variable at the same time. From the e89e data file the data of 3 differently segregated areas can be separated: 1 - "normal size" segregated Roma districts - KISKORZ=0 és SZEGREG=3. 2 - "small size" segregatd Roma districts - KISKORZ=1 és SZEGREG=3. 3 - rendered probable based on estimates "normal size" Roma segregated districts - KISKORZ=0 and SZEGREG=2.
